channel.title: The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz
channel.description: From their Oceanside studios at the Clevelander Hotel in Miami Beach, Dan Le Batard, Stugotz and company share their unique perspectives on all-things sports, pop-culture and more. This is the place for original content from Lebatard and Stu Gotz, including the daily “Local Hour” generally focusing on the South Florida scene, the Big Suey, and a few more surprises along the way.

image.title: The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz

channel.itunes:subtitle: This is the place for the hourly podcasts for The Dan LeBatard Show, plus original content produced before and after the show, including the “Local Hour,” the podcast-only hour, and a few surprises along the way.

item.title: Hour 1: Why Did The Mascot Get Arrested?
item.description: Le Batard, Stugotz and the crew discuss the fall of “Edge” NFL Matchup, Pat McAfee’s wardrobe on College GameDay and the Miami Hurricanes mascot getting arrested in 1989. Also, Ricky Williams breaks down Kanye’s astrological chart. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Big Suey: Meadowlarkers 53 "Kyrie Irving and Joshua Primo"
item.description: Tom Haberstroh, Amin Elhassan, and Kate Fagan dive into two of the biggest off-the-court storylines plaguing the NBA today. First, the lawsuit against Joshua Primo and the San Antonio Spurs alleging Primo exposed himself to multiple women, including a Spurs team psychologist, and that the Spurs ignored reports and covered it up. Then, the crew dives into Kyrie Irving and antisemitism, his initial press conferences, and the league's first reactions to his rhetoric. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: #BecauseMiami: Agua, Mierda y Factoria
item.description: A dead engineer has been signing off on safety inspections for buildings across South Florida. Billy Corben will tell you more about it. Plus, we have The Lightning Round. And N. Patrick Range, former chairman of the Virginia Key Beach Park Trust Board, joins the show to tell us how he and the rest of the board were unduly ousted by the Miami City Commission. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: God Bless Football: Brian Daboll's Briefcase
item.description: Brian Daboll tells us how his famous introductory video came about and turns Stugotz and Billy against each other (3:44). The guys upset legend Pat Hanlon. Chris Simms tells us how many times a day he showers (24:19). Stu Ya Gotz (42:08). Mike Golic preps us for Tennessee vs. Georgia and his weekend with Stugotz at Notre Dame (45:51). Carl Douglas, Joba and K-Funk make picks as Mojo and Chris go missing (1:03:45). John O'Hurley inexplicably makes 5 NFL picks to take us into the big football weekend (1:19:16). Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Local Hour: Do You Dream Of Michael Bublé?
item.description: George Benson, Michael Bublé, and some Ambien kick off the David Samson Local Hour. He covers last night's World Series no-hitter and what Mike had on his three screens instead. Then, David questions Adam Silver and analyzes Kyrie Irving's most recent statement full of platitudes and empty of an apology. Plus, Kanye West, Ime Udoka, Daniel Snyder, and Billy Corben's new documentary, "God Forbid." Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Postgame Show: Transition
item.description: We begin the Postgame Show with all the details on the Josh Primo story in San Antonio and what's been underreported thus far. Amin, Dan, and Hawk discuss Primo, Ime Udoka, and where ethical lines are drawn in an effort to win. Then, after a smooth transition, JuJu Gotti gets us prepared for him and Tony to take over New York for UFC 281 before reaching into his bag of gifts for the Shipping Container. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 2: A Record Number Of Bros
item.description: With news of the Washington Commander hiring BofA Securities to explore selling the team, we discuss Daniel Snyder being able to cash out despite gross incompetence, who takes over the mantle as "most hated owner," and who could replace Snyder in Washington. Then, Nick Swisher joins the show with potentially the most energy anyone has ever brought to an interview to discuss wearing a thong for superstitious reasons, how baseball’s evolved since he played, charging the mound, skin care routines, and more. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Hour 1: Excellence Over Humanity
item.description: The show addresses three off-the-court stories in the NBA including Josh Primo, Ime Udoka, and Kyrie Irving. We discuss where the NBA dropped the ball on Kyrie's lack of punishment and why the Nets could believe Ime Udoka will be okay in their workplace despite his issues in Boston. Plus, Mike Schur joins us for a World Series Stat of the Day, his thoughts on Udoka, and why the Republican response to the attack of Paul Pelosi signals the death of reasonable discourse in America. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Local Hour: Teach Me Joy
item.description: The Miami Dolphins are all in after a flurry of aggressive trade deadline moves, and Witty doesn't know what to do with his hands! Then, why do the Packers refuse to make moves for Aaron Rodgers' offense? And the Heat look to be back on track after a victory over the Warriors, and Amin is here to break down how Bam Adebayo, Duncan Robinson, and zone defense made it happen. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Big Suey: Anti-Semantics
item.description: Does Billy enjoy a random Amin trip to the studio or Greg Cote Tuesdays more? Amin tells us what's wrong with the Lakers and why a trade with the Pacers makes less sense than we think. Then, a thorough discussion on Kyrie Irving and antisemitism in the United States after Kyrie shared an antisemitic movie to his IG and Twitter and defended his actions in a postgame press conference. item.title: God Bless Football- The BCS and Roselyn the witch!
item.description: Stugotz and Billy react to a not great but not terrible Thursday Night Football game between Lamar Jackson and Tom Brady. Chris Simms gets us ready for Week 8 in the NFL and casually tells us about the time Madonna got in the way of him selling his condo to A-Rod (8:46). Stu give you winner in Stu Ya Gotz (34:39). Chris Cote joins the show to discuss dirty names in college football with Mike Golic (38:25) and to reveal the first BCS Rankings of the season (48:43). Friendly witch, Priestess Roselyn, joins Carl Douglas, Joba Chamberlain, K-Funk and a surprise guest to make NFL picks (59:17). Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Big Suey: Meadowlarkers 51 "An Athlete In The Family"
item.description: The Meadowlarkers crew is back in full force as Kate, Howard, and Amin discuss a recent article from The Atlantic about the downsides of having an athlete in the family. The crew dives into the professionalization of youth sports and how it's taken away from free play for kids and changed the way we view sports as a whole. As a child becomes the "family business," how does it change relationships with their parents and even their siblings? And how do college scholarships being associated with sports affect how we approach them? The Meadowlarkers are here to explain. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: God Bless Football: Freeney, Babers, Reich and Carl Douglas
item.description: Chris Simms realizes Billy, Stugotz and Mikey A. don't regularly watch him on tv when they compliment his outfit. Syracuse alum, Dwight Freeney, joins the show to talk to Dino Babers about this weekend's big game between #18 Syracuse and #14 NC State and for the guys to try to get coach to agree to retire his number. Stugotz makes his weekly college and pro picks. Frank Reich is back to to preview Colts vs. Jags and to see if the show is actually cursed. item.title: Hour 2: Meg Linehan on the NWSL
item.description: We don't know what baseball players look like. Mike Schur joins us for his Stat of the Day and gets into the Draymond Green-Jordan Poole debacle and the Warriors aging process. Then, Meg Linehan of The Athletic joins us to share how her reporting helped lead to Sally Yates' report on NWSL allegations of misconduct. She explains the systemic problem of silence and complicity in women's soccer, gender and power dynamics, how power ultimately gets abused, and how this is just the tip of the iceberg within the sport. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Big Suey: The New York B-Teams
item.description: Billy's Marlins helped Stugotz's Mets stay alive to win the NL East, so we take a trip through why Mets fans are so insecure and how it feels to play spoiler when you're helping a team you hate. Then, Stugotz torches Matthew Stafford and vigorously defends Jimmy G which leads us to dueling lists: Mike's Top 5 Worst Super Bowl Winning QBs and Stu's Top 5 Most Overrated Super Bowl Winning QBs. Plus, an interview with CrossFit Games Champion, the fittest on earth, Tia-Clair Toomey. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Local Hour: Chris Nowinski on Tua Injury
item.description: Dan, Stugotz, Witty, Mike Ryan, and Chris Cote discuss Tua Tagovailoa's head injury sustained during Thursday Night Football. The crew dives into the NFL concussion protocol, how they view last week's injury in relation to this one, and the rapid response across social media. Then, neuroscientist and founder of the Concussion Legacy Foundation, Chris Nowinski, joins Dan to break down the injury and what he believes the repercussions should be. item.title: The Big Suey: Meadowlarkers 48 "What Are You, Stupid?"
item.description: The Meadowlarkers are back to their full roster with Howard Bryant, Kate Fagan, and Amin Elhassan diving into both the Robert Sarver and Ime Udoka stories in the NBA. The crew analyzes the journalistic ethics in the reporting on Udoka, the currency of reporting on Twitter, the new era of owners being pressured to sell franchises, men and women working together in sports, public vs. private citizens, power dynamics along race and gender lines, and more. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Andre Iguodala's Decision™ | To Come Back or Call It a Career
item.description:
Andre Iguodala, four-time NBA champion and co-host of the Point Forward podcast, spent the summer assessing whether or not he was going to return for his 19th NBA season. In this special edition of the Point Forward podcast with his close friend and co-host Evan Turner, Iguodala shares his decision, the reasoning behind it, and discusses who had an impact on the final call.
Stay tuned for Season 2 of Point Forward, with interviews here on YouTube and the complete podcasts available wherever you prefer to listen to your favorite pods.
Subscribe and follow Point Forward to make sure you don't miss anything Andre, Evan, or their incredible casts of guests are saying!

item.title: God Bless Football: Aaron Rodgers, Tim Tebow, Kurt Angle and Dan Le Batard!
item.description: Dan Le Batard joins GBF to reunite with Aaron Rodgers and to discuss Aaron passing the torch to Tua. Stugotz and Billy pitch Tim Tebow some ideas for how UF could honor him. Mike Golic tells us how his golf cart was "stolen". Chris Simms gets us ready for week 3. Kurt Angle and Gordie Gronk join, Mojo, Joba, K-Funk and Chris to pick some NFL games.
